Wisdom: الظَّنُّ يُخْطِئُ وَالْيَقِينُ يُصِيبُ وَلَا يُخْطِئُ
enWisdom: Conjecture errs, but certainty is [always] right and does err
Correct conjecture is one for the two [possible] views

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ أَنْ تَغْلِبَكَ نَفْسُكَ عَلَى مَا تَظُنُّ وَلَا تَغْلِبُهَا عَلَى مَا تَسْتَيْقِنُ فَإِنَّ ذَلِكَ مِنْ أَعْظَمِ الشَّرِّ
enWisdom: Beware of letting your [lower] self overwhelm you in that which it presumes [of this world] while you do not overcome it in that which you are certain [of the Hereafter], for indeed this is from the gravest of evils
It is possible that conjecture may [turn out to] be correct
The conjecture of a man is to the extent of his intellect

Wisdom: ظَنُّ الْإِنْسَانِ مِيزَانُ عَقْلِهِ وَفِعْلُهُ أَصْدَقُ شَاهِدٍ عَلَى أَصْلِهِ
enWisdom: The conjecture of a person is the measure of his intellect and his action is the truest witness about his origin

Wisdom: لَيْسَ مِنَ الْعَدْلِ الْقَضَاءُ عَلَى الثِّقَةِ بِالظَّنِّ
enWisdom: It is not from justice to judge a reliable person by conjecture [instead of accepting his testimony]
Little conjecture [and uncertainty] is [a means of falling into] doubt
